title: Why We Trust Familiar Brands
description: Learn Why We Trust Familiar Brands in one minute.

hook.text: You've never tested Colgate against rivals. But you buy it every time because you always have.

buildup.text: The mere exposure effect means repeated contact with something makes us like and trust it more.

twist.text: Familiarity feels like safety. Brands saturate your environment with their presence to exploit this.

climax.text: For sellers, the lesson is visibility. Stay present. The more a buyer encounters your name, the more they trust.

quiz.question: What is the mere exposure effect?
options: Repeated exposure increases liking and trust
